docstring.long_description:
The description of that function is as follows:

    Compute the standard error of the mean.

    Calculate the standard error of the mean (or standard error of measurement) of the values in the input array.
docstring.short_description: The SEM node is based on a numpy or scipy function.

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: An array containing the values for which the standard error is returned.

parameters.name: axis
parameters.description:
Axis along which to operate.
Default is 0.
If None, compute over the whole array 'a'.

parameters.name: ddof
parameters.description:
Delta degrees-of-freedom. How many degrees of freedom to adjust
for bias in limited samples relative to the population estimate of variance.
Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: nan_policy
parameters.description:
Defines how to handle when input contains nan.
The following options are available (default is 'propagate'):
'propagate' : returns nan
'raise' : raises an error
'omit' : performs the calculations ignoring nan values
